title: Limbaugh Sees War In Stephen Colbert Replacing Letterman

comments.text:
I agree with Limbaugh, The show will be HORRIBLE if Stephen Colbert 
replaces Letterman !
 I don't like Limbaugh.....
I respect and love TYT...... 
But> Stephen Colbert is Boring, dry, drab, and he is going to change the 
comedy style that Letterman made for the show, and Stephen Colbert will 
ruin everything Letterman has done!!!﻿

comments.text:
I am wondering, because I actually haven't seen it, whether Rush has ever 
had to recite what traditional American values are? Anyone can howl about 
assault on these American values and 'followers' can yawp agreement, but 
when pressed to strict definition, how well can they stack up and how much 
must they defend themselves against people who simply disagree with their 
definition?﻿

comments.text:
Has anyone noticed that Limbaugh is hiding from the people he attacks? 
I mean, he sits in his mansion and disparages the integrity and patriotism 
of public figures he'd never have the courage to engage with directly. 
He's a bomb thrower, and his name-calling shtick only works when he hides 
from the people he targets- if he actually spoke to them he'd have be 
polite. 
Why would anyone listen to such a coward? 
If Rush's views were really so much better than those espoused by the 
people he criticizes he'd have the guys to engage with them in debate. 
Instead he's just alone in his bubble, hiding. ﻿

comments.text:
>  his incessant smugness and arrogance can be way over the top.<

SCHTICK:

Yiddish slang meaning "gimmick" that has come to mean "someone's signature 
behavior." In the 1940's, Jewish comedians in the Catskills referred to 
their comedy routines as their schtick.

* you really don't grasp that part, huh?
comments.author: DarwinsFriend

comments.text:
See you are missing the point.  Colbert is a LOUSY choice.  He is arrogant, 
and a snob and will probably NOT change his "shtick " when guests are on. 
 And I can tell you, not all guests are going to like his rudeness, 
arrogant, and narcissism.  His comedy can get old real fast.  He has no 
humility and is a constant boastful, selfish cynic.  You cannot use that 
comedy on a talk show with guests night after night.  He is a die hard 
hater of Christianity and all things conservative and he is blatant and 
bold about it, way worst than Kimmel, and Fallon.  this is not going to 
work.  He is going to insult a lot of people and some Hollywood people are 
not going to put up with him portraying himself (on the air!) more 
important than his guests!  Arrogant smug and cynical humor does not work 
very long.  He is not even gracious.  Behind the scenes, many employees on 
this TV show site are known to hate him.  He is difficult to work for.﻿

comments.text:
Rush might have a point if Colbert gets millions of viewers every night and 
continues his same satirical attack on perceived right wingers. Because 
let's face it, Colbert doesn't satirize the Democrats or progressives in 
his acts.

Having said that, I don't think Rush needs to worry too much even if there 
is a left wing threat in Colbert. Rush Limbaugh, despite the leftists 
literally foaming at the mouth because of their hatred of him, has an 
average 14 million listeners, far more than any left-wing equivalent 
anywhere in the world.﻿

comments.author: Joe Schmoe

comments.text:
+Joe Schmoe  True - but understand that using ElRushbo as a target is a 
major waste of resource.

Colbert has THE JOB.

New York is the hub and pretty much always has been, and even if they move 
Letterman's old show to the West Coast, it will focus on the 25 to 50 years 
olds and their Porsche / BMW / Infinity demographics.

The Late Show is long-in-the-tooth and Colbert won't have to employ his 
shtick to work this audience. Tongue-in-cheek political comments will no 
doubt peek out at times, but this guy is hip enough to master his own style 
in that incredibly influential slot.

If it were not so - Limbaugh wouldn't be so pissed off and showing his real 
nature. I'm an old fuck and I've watched since Jack Parr. ;-)

comments.author: Scot Watson

comments.text:
+Scot Watson .*"Colbert doesn't satirize the Democrats or progressives in 
his acts"* - That's because his character is against the democrats and 
progressives; so when they do something wrong his character points it out 
 (and it builds his character in the opposite way of when he pretends to 
support idiots on the other side) and he doesn't have to be ironic about it.
"has an average 14 million listeners" - Over a week, so basically he has 14 
million consistent listeners total. And who knows how that figure was 
calculated, I listen to him sometimes, am I a fraction of a listener? Or 
what about multiple people listening to the same radio? 
"far more than any left-wing equivalent anywhere in the world" - I didn't 
realize you were an expert on worldwide ideology and popular figures... I'd 
wager that Kim Jong-un has more listeners than Rush, and that's pretty left 
wing (communism). Although to be fair the authoritarian style of government 
is close to fascism (which is far right wing).

hiring Colbert is just silly.

Ever actually watch Rush on television? Wow - what a hard-off. In Los

I can understand why ElRushbo says this move by CBS is war in Mom & Pop 
Iowa. But it hasn't been any different since the late 1960's, as the folks 
on the nations coasts have always sponsored national elections, created 
trends in art, media, movies and clothing.

Contributors elect anyone in Congress and above - that's how the system 
works - and the U.S. Supreme Court has just reaffirmed that "Money is 
Voice" reality.

If I were Limbaugh I'd be pissed off too. His followers are becoming less 
and less in numbers and intellectual capitol. That dooms the RNC to some 
desperate choices.﻿

comments.author: cobramcjingleballs

comments.text:
+cobramcjingleballs"the new values are killing 1 million babies a year 
through abortion" If you believe killing a < 3 month old fetus is akin to 
murdering a baby. We are discussing the values...illustrated.. in this 
example. There are those those who believe the soul.. arrives.. at or 
sometime shortly after conception, but there is scientific evidence that 
consciousness begins later. And for (some of) those who believe the latter, 
"murder" is defined, approximately, as "killing something capable of 
experiencing suffering".
" rampant sexuality" That's from your perspective. Also, you are 
generalizing a lot of people. Some people want a lot of sex, and to look 
sexy, some don't.
"occultism (look at any music video with its pentagrams and pyramid 
symbols)" You are putting together every religious or spiritual belief 
system into a box, besides christianity. I'd guess you believe they are all 
following your 'satan'.
 "discrediting of christianity" There are people who feel that christianity 
need not be the way, as strongly as you feel it is.
"destruction of the family" This one is tough, I'll admit. I am skeptical 
of our government, and I don't think they could help parents raise children 
properly at this time. However, children are not toys, to do with as you 
please... I say a New World Order is past due, the Old one is fucked up.

Interesting discussion. These are just my thoughts, as refined as I can 
make them at this time.

comments.text:
+haiggoh
 They arent bringing in Colbert to hold on to Letterman's dying off 
audience. They are bringing in Colbert to deliver a death blow to the two 
Jimmys on NBC and ABC.   The Colbert Nation is huge and now is going to get 
even bigger when Colbert will now be nationally shown.

All the broadcast networks are aiming for the new generation audience, 
which is larger than the old audience that's depleting which is why 
Letterman's ratings have been declining signaling to Dave that his time has 
come. 

The Colbert Report is a late night talk show, so there's not much needing 
to change, and I'm certain CBS is aware of the type of comedy and humor 
Stephen Colbert is known of doing otherwise I doubt they would make an 
offer to him.

CBS knows what its doing, and all I can say is get ready for a war.
Rush Limbaugh doesn't have a clue about comedy which is why he's on radio, 
dying terrestrial radio.
